attributes.action: Stop heckling and jeering in Commons to allow real political discussion to occur
attributes.additional_details: Please refer to all Prime Minister's Questions since the ascension of Jeremy Corbyn to leader of the opposition to illustrate the issues with our parliament.
attributes.background: After watching 100 PMQs questions put forward by Jeremy Corbyn, and watching 100 questions receive nothing but jeering and heckling from the other side of the Commons, there should be a motion passed that prohibits this from happening on either side of the Government. This will allow real democracy.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition in its current form as it does not call for a clear action from the UK Government and Parliament. You could start a petition calling for a specific action which might stop heckling and jeering in the House of Commons.

In the meantime you might be interested in signing the following petitions: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/113233
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/121149
